name: Avoid referring to internal Guice classes
body:
Avoids depending on `com.google.inject.internal.CircularDependencyProxy` explicitly.
Instead only use it if the class can be found at runtime.

This will make it easier for folks looking to upgrade the Guice version.

name: Update Jetty to latest 9.4.* patch
body: Resolution: https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGECLIPSEJETTY-1021614

name: Update Jetty to latest 9.2 patch
body: Dependency-only release for Jetty updates

name: Governator Java11 compatibility
body:
Added missing Java11 dependencies.
Shaded ASM to avoid conflicts.

name: governator-jetty updates
body: add finer-grained configuration options to governator-jetty, including max header size

name: fix assisted inject predestroy
body: Instances provisioned by Guice using assisted injection that also declare lifecycle methods (such as @PreDestroy annotated methods or implement AutoCloseable) are not handled correctly. This bugfix release introduces specific handling of the NO_SCOPE scope built into Guice, to ensure that associated instances using lifecycle methods are handled correctly.

name: Fix PreDestroyMonitor memory leak
body: fixes a memory leak caused by unscoped instances injected via Provider. The situation commonly occurs when a provider is declared for a type that implements AutoCloseable or is annotated with '@PreDestroy'. At runtime, the injected instances are bound with 'no scope' by Guice, leading to a large number of cleanup actions pointing to potentially the same object.

#348 Change Grapher#graph roots check to be isEmpty instead of null
#375 Log info message after injector created successfully
#378 use release version of spock
#379 update to the latest gradle and nebula versions

name: Use Stage.TOOL
body: Always use Stage.TOOL when using ElementVisitors for inspection of bindings prior to injector creation.

name: Remove support for JSR-303 Validation
body: Removed [JSR-303 Bean Validation support](https://github.com/Netflix/governator/wiki/Field-Validation). This feature was no longer being used internally and only served to tie Governator to old versions of hibernate-validator.

name: fix predestroy ordering
body: predestroy ordering can happen out-of-order with combinations of eager singletons and non-eager singletons; the problem has been addressed in this release.

name: fix predestroy ordering
body: predestroy ordering can happen out-of-order with combinations of eager singletons and non-eager singletons; the problem has been addressed in this release.

- Fix ConfigurationProvider initialization ordering 
- Fix RequestScope injection in Governator-Jersey integration
- Warn of use of non Jersey singleton in Jersey resources instead of trying to create them eagerly

- Eagerly create Jersey root resources
- Allow for adding profiles via multbindings in a guice module

name: ProvidesWithAdvice bug fix
body: - Fix @ProvidesWithAdvice to properly isolate @Advises for different types

Enable Provisioning Metrics by Default
Some bug fixes for JUnit test util

name: ProvisionMetricsModule hot fix
body: - Fix deduping of ProvisionMetricsModule

- More aspects of JettyModule configurable 
- Include class name in class path scanning errors
- InjectorBuilder API improvements for iterating all elements
- Include PostConstruct time in provision metrics
- Fix memory leaks in SimpleProvisionMetrics

- No more Jersey class path scanning in GovernatorJerseySupportModule
- Fix java8 and invokedynamic issues
- Fix ScanningModuleBuilder module dedup
- JettyConfig archaius2 integration
- Add ability to set Jetty context path via JettyConfig

name: restore LifecycleMethods methods
body: internal class LifecycleMethods lost three public methods in the 1.15 release; these have been restored with 1.15.2 for compatibility with external callers

name: bug fix for Java 8 and invokedynamic
body: runtime errors found with Java 8 (String.valueOf bound incorrectly) and with invokedynamic / get applied to static field

name: Performance Tuning
body:
Tuning with an eye towards use of short-lived scopes. Changes based on a test load of 200 threads injecting scoped instances with a ttl between 0-500ms; see PreDestroyStressTest. Some of the more significant improvements:

'invoke dynamic' invocation of lifecycle methods and configuration fields
reduced lock contention in PreDestroyMonitor
reduced partition contention in LifecycleManager.objectStates
caching of @PreDestroy parsing in LifecycleManager
caching of @Resource detection in LifecycleMethods
Also includes a bug fix to allow use of 'Binder.requireExplicitBindings()' feature and bumped Guice dependency to 4.1.0

Update - added bug fix for nested LifecycleListener notification
Rollback duplicated guice 4.1.0 safeguard
Bugfix in supporting Guice 4.1.0

name: Upgrade to Guice 4.1.0
body:
Upgrade to Guice 4.1.0
Deprecate all LifecycleInjectorBuilder methods that take module classes instead of instances

name: bug fixes and guice 4.1.0 compatibility
body:
In this release:
- fix NPE thrown for @Nullable injections with null value
- fix NPE thrown for singleton @Resource injections when using Guice 4.1.0
- fix provision duration calculating for a type

name: improved memory management and scope-aware lifecycle processing
body:
this release has the following improvements:
- improved lifecycle detection for instances in short-lived scopes (such as RequestScope)
- use of weak references to track internal instance state and lifecycle actions
- bug fixes for legacy-path lifecycle management of scoped beans

name: Fix bug with static resources on embedded Jetty
Fix Jetty initialization with static resources

body:
Set JSR-250 validation as optional by default
Update JettyModule to serve META-INF/resources by default as per servlet spec

- New JUnit TestRunner with support for replacing bindings with Mockito Mocks
- LifecycleListeners now invoked in order of registration and reverse order for onStopped events
- Add AutoCloseable support to PreDestroyLifecycleActions
- Deprecated @Warmup
